comment: Only grade is 3 short answer exams. If you go to class he explains the concepts very well. Do the HW outside of class and review your notes, you'll be fine. He grades the exams fairly -- looks at the work, not the answer. I got an  A in the course.

Awesome professor. He teaches the subject very effectively. Highlights the important areas to focus on in the class. Always willing to help outside of class. First test was easy...second a little tougher and the final was rough.
Very knowledgeable, he knows what he is teaching and teaches it effectively..

Prof. Park is one of the sweetest prof. in the accounting department. He's nice and willing to help unclear questions. Take him if you can, but remember this is an accounting class so I will recommend studying hard and do the home works.
he is awesome

Very congenial, funny acctg. prof. He knows much about acctg. and makes it less boring with his enthusiasm. He is very clear despite speaking English as a 2nd language. 3 equally weighted exams with 3 mc q's followed by several written parts. He grades very fairly based on how well you know the concepts, whether or not you make a minor error.
Attend all his classes and take notes; he has a passion for the subject and wants you to succeed.
This is the hardest class I've ever taken at KSU. Dr. Park is a great guy, but he is extremely hard to understand. I would take someone else.

Awesome professor!! He is always happy and loves to teach! Has a great sense of humor, so class isn't completely boring. Material isn't easy, but he does a great job explaining everything and helps you out in any way he can. He is a very fair grader and tests aren't cumulative. I would highly recommend!

Enthusiastic and fun to listen to, especially for the long late-night grad classes.  His slides are ok, always available.  Tests were harder than I expected because it seemed different, and more difficult from classwork. He explains and reiterates a lot, so you get the material. Very nice professor. Helpful, wants you to understand.

Great professor. Really cares about the students and knows his topic. Two exams - all essay. But he grades fair and thoroughly goes over all material needed in class. Uses PP and lots of examples. I would recommend going to class. I read the book and did the suggested problems and did well on exams.

Professor Park is awesome.  His tests are basically only 3 tests including the final.  His test are not cumulative, so it was a relief.  The best way to succeed in his class is to come to class and take notes of his examples.  They are very helpful.  Acct 4050 is a tough class, but i learn alot from him.
Dr. Park is a great guy. I didn't always understand him, but he made this class fun. He enjoyed teaching the class and I enjoyed attending.

An extremely enthusiastic and passionate professor. A great sense of humor! Only 3 tests for your grade (all non-cumulative). Gives sample tests for study guides and teaches from Powerpoint slides. A bit of an accent, but if you are in class to learn, you won't have any trouble understanding him. I highly recommend this professor!!

Very enthusiastic and fun professor. He keeps the lectures light; I wish I had a miniture Taewoo for my dashboard. He's somewhat hard to understand / language barrier. All notes are available to download and take to class(recomended). 3 equal weighted exams non-cumulative. Exams are HARDER than practice exams given to study by.
VERY GOOD PROFESSOR!

Dr. Park loves what he does and it shows. He is always happy and explains things clearly. I didn't always get the material in class, but once I got home I remembered what he wrote on the board in class. You have to study for this class to do well. I got an A but I STUDIED.
Fantastic teacher! Dr. Park is lively, respectful, responsive, and always smiling. He's passionate about accounting and I learned a lot in his class.

Prof Park was def a nice guy, study and go to class and you will do fine. Just three tests, no final, just last test.  He gives decent test reviews.  If you go to class you will be ok.  He's a nice guy.

One of the best accounting prof's I've had.  3100 is a hard class, but Prof. Park explains everything very well and is very helpful.  Your grade is based on 3 tests, no final.  If you just go to class and pay attention, you can easily get an A or B.  If you're an accounting major, I recomend him because you actually learn all of the material.

Grade is based on 3 tests and nothing else, the final is not comprehensive, and they are very similar to examples he gives during class.  If you do the homework (which is not graded) and pay attention in class, you can get an A.
No Comments
